title: Bad loans haunt Greek banks seeking new start
content: ATHENS: Turned down for a 10,000 euro (US$11,100) loan, George Sarris is one of hundreds of thousands of small business owners shunned by Greek banks. Pointing to the parliament building overlooking his small cafe in Athens’ Syntagma Square, the 35-year-old blames Greece’s turbulent politics for the troubles of its banking system. “It took three years […]
